Logged attempts to modify or read system.Action: Monitor Windows Event logs for suspicious process creation (Event ID 4688) attempting to access firmware-related drivers or locations. Monitor network device audit logs for unexpected firmware modification attempts. Compare timestamps of attempts against known, authorized firmware updates/patches. Use time series analysis to identify unusual bursts of activity targeting firmware interfaces.

Unexpected system or network device fail.Data: Windows Event ID 1074, Windows Event ID 6005, Windows Event ID 6006, Zeek conn.log
Unexpected system or network device fail.Action: Collect system shutdown/startup events (Windows Event ID 1074, 6005, 6006) and network device syslogs indicating crashes or unexpected reboots. Correlate timestamps of these events with any detected attempts to access or modify firmware. Use correlation analysis to identify statistically significant relationships between firmware access attempts and device instability. Investigate hosts/devices experiencing sudden, unexplained failures or reboot loops.
